messages.subject: Another question
messages.msgSnippet: In Haynes Catalogue 5, 27 March 1983, the item descriptions of tsubas, kodogu, even ukiyoe, and reference books almost always finish with parenthesized
messages.messageBody:
In Haynes Catalogue 5, 27 March 1983, the item descriptions of tsubas, kodogu, even ukiyoe, and reference books almost always finish with parenthesized numbers. These references consist of a Roman numeral followed by an Arabic number, e.g. VII-26. Does anyone know what is being referenced?

I have looked in the front & back of catalogues 1, 5, and 10, and not found an apparatus so far.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
